academy.mindswap.games_factory.wheel_of_fortune.wheel

Class Wheel

  • java.lang.Object
    • academy.mindswap.games_factory.wheel_of_fortune.wheel.Wheel

  • public class Wheel
extends java.lang.Object
    Class responsible for creating a wheel of fortune with different random outcomes provided by the enum Command class It's also responsible for sending the wheel spinning animation for the players. Needs access to Game's broadcast method Invoking the spinWheel method it will return an random enum from the Command class

      • Wheel

        public Wheel()

    • Method Detail

      • createWheel

        public void createWheel(int numberOfOptions,
                        double percentageOfPenalties)
        Creates a distributed random wheel of fortune with different outcomes provided by the enum Command class Before the wheel is spun this method must be invoked;
        Parameters:
        numberOfOptions - the number of different outcomes that the wheel will have
        percentageOfPenalties - the percentage between 0 and 1 of penalties that the wheel has. 0.25 is recommended

      • spinWheel

        public Command spinWheel()
                  throws NoWheelException
        Method to get a random Command from the created wheel
        Returns:
        a random Command from enum Command class
        Throws:
        NoWheelException - when no wheel was created before invoking this method

      • animate

        public void animate(Command luckyOption,
                    int turns,
                    WheelOfFortune game)
             throws NoWheelException,
                    NullGameException
        Method responsible for broadcasting to players clients the wheel animation. It goes trough the created wheel and sends a substring of 9 chars followed by a \r to clear the line on PlayerClient's console. For the animation to work the PlayerClient's must be reading the sent message char by char.
        Parameters:
        luckyOption - the Command from the enum Command that will be shown at the end of the class
        turns - the amount of turns that wheel will spin before stop
        game - the needed game object with a broadcast method to use to send the spinning animation to the players
        Throws:
        NoWheelException - when no wheel was created before invoking this method
        NullGameException - when the provided game object is null
